intro: Marlea barbata, commonly known as the hairy spurflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and colorful, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. Marlea barbata is well adapted to arid conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
